steps.title: Chemical suppliers sell 100% pure ethanol.
steps.content: Chemical suppliers sell 100% pure ethanol. You can find a variety of pure ethanols at these types of stores. Suppliers also sell specific types of ethanol, like the kinds designed specifically for molecular biology and other types of lab work. Groups like Ethanol US, Xtractor Depot, and Parchem are great options. These types of ethanol are typically denatured, which means they aren’t safe to drink. You don’t need a special permit or license to buy denatured alcohol. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Groups like Amazon sell ethanol in many shapes and sizes.
steps.content: Groups like Amazon sell ethanol in many shapes and sizes. Open up Amazon’s website or app and scroll through results. This popular marketplace has all kinds of ethanol, ranging from a standard laboratory product to ethanol-based hand sanitizer. Many listings are labeled as “ethyl alcohol.” Not to worry—this is just another name for ethanol. You can find pure ethanol on Amazon. You can buy medical-grade ethanol through Amazon. Other online marketplaces, like eBay, also sell ethanol.

steps.title: Walmart sells ethanol in many different forms.
steps.content: Walmart sells ethanol in many different forms. Shop for a variety of ethanol-based products, like fuel stabilizer, fireplace fuel, as well as gel chafing fuels. Walmart also partners with several suppliers who sell pure, denatured ethanol. Product availability may depend on where you live, and what your local Walmart traditionally has in stock.

steps.title: Food-grade alcohol is sold from marketplaces, laboratories, and other third-party sites.
steps.content: Food-grade alcohol is sold from marketplaces, laboratories, and other third-party sites. Unlike other varieties, ethanol with a “food grade” label is safe to drink and use in recipes. Big online marketplaces like Amazon sell this type of ethanol, as do laboratory supply shops. Check the supplier’s website, as well as your region’s alcohol laws. Some places don’t require you to have a permit to buy this type of ethanol. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Amazon sells medical-grade ethanol, as do laboratory suppliers.
steps.content: Amazon sells medical-grade ethanol, as do laboratory suppliers. This type of ethyl alcohol is great for medical purposes, cosmetic uses, and personal care. [4] X Research source Food- and medical-grade ethyl alcohol are lumped into the same category of ethanol.

steps.title: Some suppliers sell ethanol in 55 US gal (210 L) drums.
steps.content: Some suppliers sell ethanol in 55 US gal (210 L) drums. Many popular stores and marketplaces, like Amazon and Walmart, sell ethanol in 1 US gal (3.8 L) containers as well.

steps.title: Flexible fuel vehicles (FFVs) can be powered by a special ethanol mixture.
steps.content: Flexible fuel vehicles (FFVs) can be powered by a special ethanol mixture. Many gas stations offer this ethanol-gasoline hybrid, also known as E85. Check this map to see if there’s a fueling station near you: https://afdc.energy.gov/fuels/ethanol_locations.html . A variety of Chevrolet, GMC, Ford, Chrysler, Dodge, Nissan, Ram, Toyota, and Mercedes-Benz car models are considered FFVs. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Find ethyl alcohol-based antiseptic at your local pharmacy.
steps.content: Find ethyl alcohol-based antiseptic at your local pharmacy. Pharmacies aren’t a great option if you’re on the hunt for pure ethanol. However, some popular chain pharmacies sell 70% ethyl rubbing alcohol, which can be used as an antiseptic. During COVID-19, some stores may not have this in stock. [6] X Research source
